snippet: More than two full months into the presidential nominating season, Rick Santorum’s campaign still has little of the slickness that many presidential campaigns exhibit by this time in the process.
abstract: Rick Santorum’s campaign is still a bare-bones operation, with little of the slickness that many presidential campaigns exhibit by this time in the Republican presidential nominating season; while critics say that the lack of frills reveal Santorum's weak organization, his campaign aides argue that the minimal staging is intentional, meant to convey Santorum's authenticity and to show that he will not spend the taxpayers' money on frippery.
lead_paragraph: More than two full months into the presidential nominating season, Rick Santorum’s campaign still has little of the slickness that many presidential campaigns exhibit by this time in the process.

headline.main: Santorum Sticks to a Bare-Bones Style
headline.print_headline: Santorum Sticks to a Bare-Bones Style
